sentences.en: A 40 watt bulb would be quite sufficient and would not obtrude.
sentences.cn: 40瓦的灯泡完全够亮了，并且不会晃眼。

sentences.en: Cut each bulb in half vertically.
sentences.cn: 将每个球茎竖切成两半。

sentences.en: That electric bulb is very bright.
The bulb of the eye is important for us.
sentences.cn: 眼球对于我们来说非常重要.

sentences.en: The dim bulb of the bedside lamp cast a soft radiance over his face.
sentences.cn: 床头灯朦胧的光柔和地投射在他脸上。

sentences.en: The dim yellow light of the fifteen - watt bulb flickered overhead.
sentences.cn: 十五支光电灯的黄光在他们头上晃着.

sentences.en: The naked bulb was directly over his head.
sentences.cn: 裸露的灯泡正好在他的头顶上方。

sentences.en: The stairwell was lit by a single bulb.
sentences.cn: 楼梯间只有一盏灯照明。

sentences.en: There was a startled look on his face when the flash bulb went off.
sentences.cn: 闪光灯灭时,他脸上一副惊愕的表情.

sentences.en: This makes the total cost of the bulb and energy £27.
sentences.cn: 这使灯泡与电费合计为27英镑。

sentences.en: We'll have to change the bulb again.
With an 18-watt fluorescent bulb you get as much light but use 75% less electricity.
sentences.cn: 用18瓦的荧光灯灯泡有同样的亮度，而用电量却减少75％。

words.tran_cn: 球根的；球根状的；由球根生长的（等于bulbaceous）
生球茎；膨胀成球状（bulb的过去分词形式）

phrases.tran_cn: [医]十二指肠冠，十二指肠球部
n. 白炽灯泡，白炽灯照

trans.tran_en: the glass part of an electric light, that the light shines from
